$eref.description: Common properties and behavior across all Cyber Observable Objects.
$eref.title: cyber-observable-core

___extensions.description: Specifies any extensions of the object, as a dictionary.

___type.description: Indicates that this object is an Observable Object. The value of this property MUST be a valid Observable Object type name, but to allow for custom objects this has been removed from the schema.

___granular_markings.description: The set of granular markings that apply to this object.

___is_defanged.description: Defines whether or not the data contained within the object has been defanged.

___object_marking_refs.description: The list of marking-definition objects to be applied to this object.

___spec_version.description: The version of the STIX specification used to represent the content in this cyber-observable.

___id.description: Specifies the identifier of the observable object, as a string.

___from_ref.description: Specifies the value of the 'From:' header of the email message.

___type.description: The value of this property MUST be `email-message`.

___raw_email_ref.description: Specifies the raw binary contents of the email message, including both the headers and body, as a reference to an Artifact Object.

$eref.description: Specifies any other header fields (except for date, received_lines, content_type, from_ref, sender_ref, to_refs, cc_refs, bcc_refs, and subject) found in the email message, as a dictionary.

___additional_header_fields.description: Specifies any other header fields found in the email message, as a dictionary.

___to_refs.description: Specifies the mailboxes that are 'To:' recipients of the email message.

___received_lines.description: Specifies one or more Received header fields that may be included in the email headers.

___sender_ref.description: Specifies the value of the 'From' field of the email message.

___subject.description: Specifies the subject of the email message.

___content_type.description: Specifies the value of the 'Content-Type' header of the email message.

___message_id.description: Specifies the Message-ID field of the email message.

$eref.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.
$eref.title: timestamp

___date.description: Specifies the date/time that the email message was sent.

___bcc_refs.description: Specifies the mailboxes that are 'BCC:' recipients of the email message.

___cc_refs.description: Specifies the mailboxes that are 'CC:' recipients of the email message.

___body.description: Specifies a string containing the email body. This field MAY only be used if is_multipart is false.

___is_multipart.description: Indicates whether the email body contains multiple MIME parts.

___body_multipart.description: Specifies a list of the MIME parts that make up the email body. This property MAY only be used if is_multipart is true.

$eref.description: Specifies a component of a multi-part email body.

___content_type.description: Specifies the value of the 'Content-Type' header field of the MIME part.

___body.description: Specifies the contents of the MIME part if the content_type is not provided OR starts with text/

___content_disposition.description: Specifies the value of the 'Content-Disposition' header field of the MIME part.

___body_raw_ref.description: Specifies the contents of non-textual MIME parts, that is those whose content_type does not start with text/, as a reference to an Artifact Object or File Object.

___is_multipart.description: Indicates whether the email body contains multiple MIME parts.

description: The Email Message Object represents an instance of an email message.
title: email-message

$eref.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs
$eref.title: dictionary

_88email-additional-header-fields.description: Specifies any other header fields (except for date, received_lines, content_type, from_ref, sender_ref, to_refs, cc_refs, bcc_refs, and subject) found in the email message, as a dictionary.

_88mime-part-type.description: Specifies a component of a multi-part email body.

___content_type.description: Specifies the value of the 'Content-Type' header field of the MIME part.

___body.description: Specifies the contents of the MIME part if the content_type is not provided OR starts with text/

___content_disposition.description: Specifies the value of the 'Content-Disposition' header field of the MIME part.

___body_raw_ref.description: Specifies the contents of non-textual MIME parts, that is those whose content_type does not start with text/, as a reference to an Artifact Object or File Object.
